sections.Known Squires:
* Ser [[Jaime Lannister]], served as squire for Ser [[Barristan Selmy]] against the [[Kingswood Brotherhood]].
* Ser [[Loras Tyrell]], served as squire for Lord [[Renly Baratheon]].
* [[Bryan]], served as Ser Jaime's squire.
* Ser {[[Alton Lannister]]}, served as Ser Jaime's squire during the Tournament to celebrate [[Willem Frey]]'s wedding after Bryan had gotten drunk. Killed by Jaime Lannister during the [[War of the Five Kings]]
* Ser {[[Hugh]] of the Vale}, served as Lord [[Jon Arryn]]'s squire for four years. Killed by Ser Gregor Clegane during the Tourney of the Hand.
* Ser [[Lancel Lannister]], served as squire for King [[Robert Baratheon]].
* [[Joss Stilwood]], squired for Ser [[Gregor Clegane]] during the Tourney of the Hand.
* [[Olyvar Frey]], made squire for [[Robb Stark]] as part of the alliance between [[House Stark]] and [[House Frey]] despite Robb not being a [[knight]].
* [[Podrick Payne]], squire for [[Tyrion Lannister]].
* {[[Martyn Lannister]]}, squire in the Lannister army during the War of the Five Kings. Killed by Lord [[Rickard Karstark]] while a hostage of [[House Tully]].
* {[[Willem Lannister]]}, squire in the Lannister army during the War of the Five Kings. Killed by Lord Rickard Karstark while a hostage of House Tully.
* [[Olyvar]], a spy and prostitute in [[Petyr Baelish]]'s employ posing as a squire to Ser [[Loras Tyrell]] in the [[Red Keep]].
*Ser [[Daemon Sand]], squire to Prince [[Oberyn Martell]], The Red Viper of Dorne.

A '''Squire''' is a (normally) young man that enters the service of a [[knight]] or lord usually with the promise of attaining knighthood at some point in the future, when the squire's master deems it proper. Squires usually take the role of a personal servant, running errands for their masters and keeping their armor, shield, weaponry, and horse ready for battle or [[tournaments]].

Men who haven't the money to buy armaments or the ambition to become a knight stay squires, and become men-at-arms.

Squires frequently fight by their master's side in battle, though very young squires do not normally participate in combat.

Even a knight can serve as a squire for another man, normally a lord. [[Daemon Sand]] squired for [[Oberyn Martell]] during the [[trial by combat]] in [[King's Landing]].
